title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Hi,

i have here a „820-01041-07“ with PPBUS_G3H on 12.23V.

When I connect it to the charger (just the logicboard / without battery) I’m getting 19.6V / 0.00-0.05A (it’s power cycling).

Already tried a DFU restore via AC2, sadly it ends with an error. (T2 is getting warm during DFU restore)

Shouldn’t be PPBUS_G3H at 12.6V? So it’s too low if you ask me.

Edit: L9080/L9081 (PIN1/2) diode values are 0.350V, when I plug in the power cable the values are going down to 0.060V. Dead SSD? If yes, is it possible to replace a faulty NAND?

Edit2:

PP5V_G3S = 0V
P5VG3S_EN = 0V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.8V
PP1V0_SLPS2R = 0.8V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1V
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE = 0.75V
PP0v82_SLPDDR = 0.82V

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
"L9080/L9081 (PIN1/2) diode values are 0.350V, when I plug in the power cable the values are going down to 0.060V"
Are you checking diode mode with power applied???
In fact, allow 10-15s after power is removed, before checking in diode mode, or ohm scale.

Incorrect PPBUS_G3H is caused by incorrect communication between T2 and ISL9240.
The voltage can be corrected by DFU sometimes, if no hardware problems on the MLB.
You should check first diode mode and voltage on battery's SCL/SDA lines.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Sry my fault .... Ignore that.

I2C_BATT_SCL_R = 1.8V / 0.456
I2C_PWR_SDA = 1.8V / 0.455

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message: Check on both sides of Q6950...

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:

I2C_BATT_SCL_R = 1.8V / 0.464
I2C_PWR_SDA = 1.8V / 0.455
I2C_PWR_SCL = 1.8V / 0.463
SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SDA = 3.3V / 0.900
SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SCL = 3.3V / 0.942

Edit: It can't complete the DFU restore / revive because the SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are not stable.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Did you check without battery connected?
If yes, check removing U6950 too.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
With and without battery, yes.
I have removed U6950, same behavior.

Edit: Just the T2 is getting „warm“.

[MEDIA=imgur]a/7LAhWZ4[/MEDIA]

Edit2: In DFU mode SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are stable.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Did you try both revive/restore options?
If yes, reflash SoC ROM and try DFU again.
Don't forget to make backup first...

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Yeah I have tried both.
Sadly I don’t have a ROM Reader/Writer, any recommendations?

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Any programmer should work.
Just need a proper 1V8 adapter and soldering board.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
[URL]https://amzn.eu/d/8XLQ3mB[/URL] (programmer)

[URL]https://amzn.eu/d/hLjAQE3[/URL] (T2 chip soldering board)

This should work right? 

which software will be used and where do I get the T2 rom file?

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
I have successfully flashed the .BIN file to the SoC ROM.

Now im getting the following message in AC2
Unexpected device state 'DFU' expected 'Recovery' (Probably forced into DFU mode externally) [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFAE (4014)]

Note: 
SOC_FORCE_DFU and PP1V8_SLPS2R are not connected.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message: Force it off with power button and try to start in DFU again.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Already tried that but sadly its entering DFU again and restore always ends with the message above.

The ".BIN" should work, right? Or is there anything I missed? Before the reflashing it wasn't 24/7 in DFU.

Edit: Also strange is that when the MB is assembled it stays on "4.97V/0.00-0.01A". After I connect my MB (with AC2 and left port close to the trackpad) it goes up to "19.7V/0.06A" and shows up in AC2.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
The dump is good.
Is normal to enter in recovery by itself, once SoC ROM has been altered.
You can try now writing back original dump.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Tried the old one again, same behavior as before. (So I need to enter manually DFU and so on.)

Edit: [MEDIA=imgur]a/6VE58qg[/MEDIA]

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Did you try with both charger and battery connected?
You may have problems with T2, or SSD.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message: Yeah tried both - How to check if the T2 or SSD is affected?

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message: Just in case, check diode mode in all coils and compare with good board.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
I don’t have a good board :/ Regarding to the “wiki” it says that “Error 4014” means bad T2 RAM or battery.

In case the RAM is bad, can it be replaced by a good one? So is the RAM serialized with T2 CPU? (CPU and RAM are “sandwiched” right?)

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
Dealing with such sandwich chip is a nightmare.
Just watch this:
[MEDIA=youtube]ZCyHy_9xY7E[/MEDIA]
I didn't hear anybody changed only upper layer; there is T2 RAM located.
Some kind of "mariage" has been done by Apple, for sure.

title: A1990 (820-01041-07) - PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
message:
